hero.body: Make A Donation Today To Support Affected Families In El Fasher, South Sudan. Your Help Could Provide Them With Food, Medicine, And Shelter, Giving Them A Chance At A More Dignified Life And Hope For A Better Tomorrow.
campaign.about.label: About The Campaign
campaign.about.title: Hope Campaign For The People Of El Fasher
campaign.about.body: A Humanitarian Campaign Aims To Raise Funds To Support Affected Families In South Sudan's El Fasher, By Providing Them With Food, Medicine, And Shelter, And Restoring Hope For A Decent Life.

testimonies.items.0.title: From The Heart Of Suffering... A Thank-You Message To Donors
testimonies.items.0.desc: Words Of Gratitude From One Of The Families Who Received Aid, Reminding Us Of The Value Of Every Contribution, No Matter How Small
testimonies.items.1.title: Testimony Of A Father Seeking A Livelihood For His Children
testimonies.items.1.desc: A grieving father shares his daily struggles to feed his family, and a touching message about the power of patience.

testimonies.items.3.desc: The story of a brave mother who lost her home in El Fasher, but still holds on to hope for a better future for her children.

about.description.city: El Fasher, the capital of North Darfur State in western Sudan, is a historic city with significant cultural and social depth. Its importance dates back centuries as the capital of the Darfur Sultanate.

about.campaign.who.title: Who We Are
about.campaign.who.copy: A non-profit humanitarian organization that supports those affected in the city of El Fasher through relief and development.
about.campaign.message.title: Our Message
about.campaign.message.copy: Delivering effective support to affected families transparently and in collaboration with humanitarian partners.
title.city: About the City of El Fasher
description.city: El Fasher is a key city in the region, known for its rich history and its role in supporting surrounding communities. Our campaign focuses on transparent, cooperative efforts to deliver effective support to affected families.
offers.title: What the Campaign Offers
offers.item1.title: Health & Relief
offers.item1.description: Providing medical assistance, primary healthcare support, and emergency relief for vulnerable families.
offers.item2.title: Food Security
offers.item2.description: Delivering food baskets and nutritional support in cooperation with humanitarian partners.
offers.item3.title: Emergency Response
offers.item3.description: Rapid interventions, first-aid kits, and coordination for urgent cases.
offers.item4.title: Water & Sanitation
offers.item4.description: Supplying clean water and hygiene kits to reduce disease risks.
stats.item1: Families assisted through medical and relief services.
stats.item2: Meals and food baskets distributed to affected households.
stats.item3: Emergency cases supported with rapid response.
stats.item4: Liters of clean water and hygiene kits delivered.

hero.title: About The City Of El Fasher
hero.body: El Fasher, the capital of North Darfur in western Sudan, is a historic city with significant cultural and social depth. Its importance dates back centuries as the capital of the Darfur Sultanate during the reign of Sultan Ali Dinar, who left a clear mark on the city's history through his monuments and architectural achievements, such as his famous palace, which still stands and is a prominent tourist attraction.

faq.title: Q&A
faq.1.question: What are the roots and causes behind the outbreak of the Battle of El Fasher?
faq.1.answer:
• Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF): The national army, seeking to maintain state authority and prevent RSF expansion into Darfur.

• Rapid Support Forces (RSF): A paramilitary group, originally from Darfur, aiming to take control of El Fasher due to its strategic and symbolic importance.

• Darfur armed movements: Some factions (e.g., JEM, SLM/Minni Minawi) sometimes supported the army to prevent RSF from seizing the city.

• Local communities: Tribal leaders and civilians—some neutral, others aligning for protection.

In essence, the army's goal is to hold the city, while the RSF's goal is to seize it as part of the broader power struggle.
faq.2.question: Who are the warring parties in El Fasher, and what are their goals?
faq.3.question: What is the humanitarian situation in El Fasher right now (refugees, food, health)?
faq.4.question: Has there been any ceasefire or agreement to stop the fighting in El Fasher?
faq.5.question: What are the possible consequences if El Fasher falls or changes control?
